1.content:
Ugh. A grinding headache encompasses your head and bids you not to move. A freezing, stony floor forces you to sit up. Where ever you are, it reeks. The smell of rust and must hangs in the air, which makes sense. Ancient pipes jutt out of the floor alongside rotting wood panels and sheet metal. Silent crying catches your attention.

It is about this time that you begin to realize that you are not alone. There are several like you in the room. Like you, they are all
1.title: A Rude Awakening

12.content:
Several exhausted pokemon and digimon inhabit the dingy cell; the crying apparently comes from a Gatomon.

"I want to play a game." A tv overhead hums to life to show a Tentomon. "You are all here for a very specific reason. You have something in common; something which I cannot say I share. I would want nothing more, but none of you seem to appreciate it." Confused grunts fill the room.

"You are all quite ticklish."

Oh shit. You don't know how you knew, but you knew. cries and gasps reaffirm your misery.

"I'm going to do you all the biggest favors of your lives. I'm going to make you appreciate your gifts; your ticklishness."

You don't want to appreciate your 'gift.' "You can have it!" you yell at the screen. A few nervous laughs tremble around you, but they lack your confidence.

"You all have twenty four hours until you are permanently locked in this house. But I am going to help you all. Throughout this house are several challenges which will yield keys. These keys will get you out of here, and that is all you need to know for now. Good luck to you all." The Gatomon starts to sob harder than ever.

...What are you again?

1222.content:
"Come on, we can get through this." Of all things, it is a Pikachu which comes to urge you on.

"Well, I think you have to." With that, the Pikachu drags you to your feet and beckons you forward.

Immediately ahead of you are two doors. Each has a face on it.
1222.title: Get on with it!

12221.content:
A fairly large Guilmon plods in through his respective door to a rust-caked room. The droning voice commands him to sit down, apparently on the misplaced beanbag chair. Reluctantly, he places his ankles into the adjacent stocks.

"Hello, Guilmon. I want to play a game. You are, by far, the most ticklish of all Digimon. Instead of the blessing which that is, you see only a curse. The machine your feet are in will tickle you, very gently, for the next nine hours."

At those words, he flinches and begins to squirm. A single, poofy feather has begun to swipe at his sole. Guilmon struggles, ever so cutely, to hold in his giggling.

"I suggest you use the control panel at your side to speed up the process, although the intensity will increase as well. The choice is yours."

Guilmon has begun to whine at the gentle, maniacal feather crawling along his thick feet.
12221.title: The horror of the automatic stocks

122211.content:
Guilmon chuckles lightly as his gentle enemy plays between his plump toes, rolling back and forth. He reaches for the simple control panel, but recoils from the tickling. The feather inches into his instep and scrapes its tip along the painfully sensitive skin. Once again, he reaches for the panel and fails, collapsing into coos and giggles.

You take pity, knowing your turn could be next, and turn the machine all the way down. "I'll set the machine to where you want. How high do you want it to go?"
122211.title: Helping!

1222112.content:
"I just ...EEE! want to get this over with. Turn heh it up to an hour."

"You sure?"

"No, but do it." Half the room is convinced that Guilmon has signed his deathwish.

"Alright. Good luck." With that, you mash the "up" button and watch the time fall away. You can get the level all the way up to 55 minutes, which makes it Level 16. A scream like you have never heard escapes Guilmon as an army of tiny, tethered hands find their ways onto his ticklish skin. Several crawl into his armpits, making him squeeze them away futilely while others claw away at his soft belly. Two pairs pull his toes apart so the menacing feather can brush the smooth skin between them. A pair of much larger hangs pinch, prod, and knead at his hips, making him buck about with exasperated laughter. He trashes around, trying to pull his gargantuan feet from the stocks.

The most notoriously ticklish digimon. Just your luck.

Following him, you immediately see another door. On it is an icon of one of the monsters.
123.title: Sucks for you

1232.content:
Rukario grits his teeth and shoves the door open.

The party filters into a white, echoing room. At the center is a strange pillory made from brushed aluminum. "Seat yourself," grinds the voice. The Rukario cracks his neck and jumps into the restraints. His back slopes slightly up from horizontal with arms crossed above his head. Legs are bent at the hips and knees with furry soles pointed slightly upwards. Thick chords pull over several vital points, securing him firmly to the chair.

"You have been a torturer, Rukario. You have tortured your brothers and friends no less than fifty times as blackmail for the assorted transgressions. You claim it an effective torture, but you do it because you love the feeling. You love the flesh trembling under your paws and the desperation it creates. You are your own worst nightmare."

A small section of wall revolves to reveal an identical Rukario. They are utterly identical, down to the slight discoloration on their ears. He ignores all of you and heads for the restrained Rukario. He yips with glee and digs his paws into the other's ribs, caressing and dragging his stubby fingers around. The first Rukario chokes out pained laughs and shutters.

"You know you would do the same if roles were reversed. You could not resist! This Rukario shares your drives; when you can have enough apathy to resist the urge, your clone will cease the torture."

The clone drags his paws down the original's legs, to the tips of his toes, and fiddles with his toes: pinching, brushing, and digging around.
1232.title: Rukario's Room

choices: Smack him hard across the face to make him wake up

Rukario decides he's had enough of this and tries to stop the clone with his aura ability, but before he can even gather the energy up to do so, the voice of TNail echoes throughout the room. "Ah-ah-ahh. We can't allow you to do that." after the reminder a small orb is lowered above Rukario's head glowing many colors before zapping Rukario. "This device will absorb all of your Power Points to be sure that you can't attack the restraints or the clone." said TNail as Rukario is screaming and struggling from the pain of the device and the clones constant tickling. "Also, if any of you try to do the same as this one... This device is in ALL of my torture chambers so escape is useless!" Rukario continues to yelp and wiggle as the clone works under the arm pits and his sides. Suddenly the clone freezes, as if he was a statue before fading away. Rukario is lying on the table... motionless. Soon the restraints unlock and Rukario falls to the floor. You pick him up and decide to bring him to his senses. Who should you go about it?

12322.title: Temporary Leave of Absense

123221.content:
You push the door labeled "Three" open without hesitation. The door slams shut behind you and two others.

"You will all be playing against each other in this room. I suggest you all take your seats."

Three seats facing towards the center of the room become the focus for the three of you. Each props their feet up on a footstool and quickly has their ankles clamped tightly. An overwhelming brightness consumes the area and, when you look back, your feet are all gone!

"Right now, your feet are sitting outside, mounted to the wall, while the rest of the party is being offered keys for whomever can make two of you give up an hit those shiny red buttons." Sure enough, a safety box on your armrest conceals a generic red button. "Whoever in here lasts the longest gets a key as well. Any drinks while we're at it?"

A tv screen swivels on an arm from under the seat, offering you multiple views of the "action." Might as well size up your competition, who are made up of

He has a point, you decide, and begin to play with the monitor in front of you. There is a button for each of you, as well as a "change angle" button. You switch to your own feet to find a close-up sole shot of them simply mounted on a slate gray wall. You flex your toes and they have no problem keeping up. You immediately quit it as to not attract attention.

The Agumon, sure enough, is already chuckling lightly to himself. Veemon licks your feet and tickles them all over which makes you squirm about giggling and trying not to laugh Charmander seems to be alright while Veemon does all he can to make you laugh you switch to Charmanders feet and see no 1 is near them switch to agumon and the Terriermon seems to have brought a hawkmon over to tickle Agumon while you are fighting to keep your laughter in Agumon is laughing out loud letting it all out and thrashing around you feel something running up and down your feet along with Veemons claws which makes it harder to not laugh you switch to your feet and notice a Bulbasaur using its vine whip to tickle all over your feet which Veemon is using his claws both Bulbasaur and Veemon seem to be compeating to see who's better at it which makes things worse for you and you start laughing out loud Charmander is smilling because he isn't being tickled yet so he just sits watching you and Agumon laughing and howling and thrashing about

"I give up please stop it I can't take it" Agumon screams "and his feet return to his body but are still restrained and his wrists are then restrained to the armrests of the chair he's sat in

"alright then Agumon you have given up the right to leave this house and the right to leave that chair you will now spend the rest of your days locked in that chair" Tentomon's voice says through some speakers"

you sit there laughing like made Charmander stil isn't being tickled so you consider giving up but would you rather die from tickling or be trapped in that chair for the rest of your life
12322111.title: Who will fall first?

124.content:
"We need to get moving!" A dark-furred Raichu steps up. "I heard of this guy before. If we stick together and keep our heads we can all get out of here alive."

The Gatomon looks up from her sobbing. "You think so?" she squeaks, voice still trembling.

"I do."

"Well I think you're full of it!" A Meowth pushes his way into the crowd. "And I think you're a little pussy!"

The Raichu pushes past him and marches through the only visable door; he is followed by the full managerie. Gatomon, paralyzed with fear, curls into a trembling ball of fur. Taking pity, you pick the poor creature up and cradle her in your arms. Her eyes lift to you and a faint smile crosses her tear-stained face.

The hallway stands as a sharp contrast to the first room. Clean, brushed metal covers most surfaces. Black bars of marble or onyx break up the steel.


Directly in front of you stands a heavy metal door. A little over your head's height sits a simple icon. You instantly recognize it as one of your group.
124.title: Moving out

choices: only watch for a moment longer
stay with him the whole time
1241.content:
The Raichu looks totally unphased. He throws the door wide open; everyone follows inside.

This room is annoyingly small. A large tank-like enclosure takes up the majority, which leaves little for the rest of you. A tv flips on overhead.

"Hello again, you Raichu. Your hatred of being tickled has gotten you into trouble before. A quick tickle to the ribs is all it took to make you shock your brother dead." The Raichu visably tenses.

"I'm going to make sure you never hurt anyone with that again. Execpt perhaps yourself. Before you is a tank. I suggest you step inside if you want to survive. Then, I would like it if you were to sit down." Raichu does not hesitate. He slides the door open, which slams shut behin d him. Moments after sitting down in the chair, his stubby arms and ancles are planted to the chair with sturdy metal. His arms are slowly raised up and feet raised until you can see his soles perfectly. They strain to appear relaxed.

"You are about to be tickled for a while, but I am not going to tell you for how long. I expect for you to discharge a bit of electricity during this time. However much you discharge, however, will be returned to you by the end of our little session. Hopefully you can survive taking it all back at once. Oh and by the way, you should take a look up." All the eyes in the room look to the ceiling. A small box is affixed within the tank.

"Perhaps you should have checked that box for the key before you sat down. Its unlocked. But its a little late for that now." Raichu is furious now; he struggles with the restraints.

"Good luck."

The tv flashes off and several tiny yet sinister-looking pikachus enter through a door near the rear of the tank. Each is blacker than midnight with flashes in their eyes. Raichu swivels his head to watch. One immediately grabs for his ribs and starts kneading furiously. It starts going so fast that it looks more like it's digging through the Raichu's side than tickling it. The raichu uses every iota of strength to suck his body away from the ticklish assult. His strength gives out and a thin stream of electricity stems from his cheecks to collect at metal orbs on the sides of the tank.
1241.title: Raichu's punishment

1242.content:
"I don't know if I can do this." A shrimpy-looking Veemon trembles behind you.

"You can." A Hawkmon steps up to pat him on the shoulder.

"I have to think about this for a while" the Veemon wavers. "We'll come back to it." He makes a vain attempt to flee; a Biyomon steps in his path.

"What's there to think about? This way you at least have a chance." The Veemon whines and the birds haul the door open for him.

A cushy seat stands in front of you. A high pair of stocks stand at the foot of the chair and the majority of an upright metal tube stands behind it.

"Sit down and strap in," drones the voice. Several flatscreens flash to life. Reluctantly, the Veemon sits down and puts his feet in the stocks.

"How about you don't lock it in," the creature meekly suggests. The birds shrug in agreement.

"I said, strap in." The voice has become audibly angry. So, the birds clamp the stocks shut. "put the rings on his middle toes." The Birds take a pair of rings, which are attached with tough cords to the stocks, and place them as instructed. They step back with forced optimism. The chair slides back into the tube and the stocks seal with it. His head is clearly visable above the tube and his feet jut out of the side a little below eye level.

"This is gonna be good!" Shouts the meowth. Raichu's cheeks begin to spark, but his attention is grabbed by the voice.

"Veemon, you are far too skittish for your own good. I am going to teach you to hold still. Above you is a weighted column." Sure enough, a solid column of steel sits above the poor creature. "You are about to be feathered for a scant five minutes. I suggest you hold your feet still." At this, a lone feather on a robotic tentacle emerges from the stocks. It waves slightly, yet menacingly.

"Should you move about too much, that column will come crashing down and your challenge will be completed. Likewise, if any of you were to attempt to help our friend by holding his feet still or grabbing the feather, the result will be no different. But don't worry- I'll be gentle."

A sandy sound alerts you all to the turning of an hourglass on the wall. Supressed laughter turns you back.

The feather arches back and touches its tip to the heel of one foot. Torturously, it begins to slide upwards. A high pitched whine and a slight twitch escape the victim. "Watch it, Vee" warns the Biyomon. The feather reaches the top and touches to the ball of his other foot before slithering down to the heel. Without any warning, it darts to his arches and begins to spin wildly.

"AAAAHHH!!" A high-pitched squeak escapes Veemon, who bites his knucle to supress the laughter; his eyes are rolled back into his head. The feather migrates back up and brushes gently between two toes. They flex involuntarily and the weight twitches.

"Gimme your hand" demands the Biyomon. She kneels down and cleches his hand to help brace his nerves. The Hawkmon mirrors her actions with his other hand. About that time, the feather moves to the tops of his feet.

"I want to see him get crushed, myself" mumbles the meowth.

Minutes pass, and the poor creature holds up- albeit barely.

Then, all of a sudden
1242.title: Veemon's Event

choices: Just get him out of there
Knock him out of his shock
12421.content:
The feather tucks away and the timer runs dry. The shock of victory takes a moment to register.

"You did it!" The Hawkmon cheers. "Veemon, you did it!" Veemon stares ahead, shocked. "Are you alright?" The Biyomon waves her wing in front of his face, but nothing comes of it. The Veemon is borderline catatonic.
12421.title: Victory?

124211.content:
"Let's just get him out of here." you suggest to the two birds standing beside the Veemon. They nod in agreement, and grab him beneath the arms and carry him into the hallway.

Veemon slowly comes around and begins to dart his head around in a panic, looking for the gigantic weight.

"It's okay, you did it, you passed!" Hawkmon said. The Veemon shook his head and looked side to side at his comrades.

"I-I did?" He stuttered. He looks to you and you knod happily. His face brightens and a grin slides across his face, "I did!" He happily begins walking, ahead of the group, leading the way. You check your pocket for the key you grabbed from the room after the challenge ended. It was there, and safe.

The morale of the group started to go up as they passed down a considerably lighter hallway than before. Then Meowth ruined it.

"I wonder who'll be next. Maybe that little Gatomon, and maybe she'll get crushed. Or better yet." Meowth smiled and then sneered at the Gatomon still in your arms. she burried her head in your chest, and you give Meowth a dirty look. He shrugs it off cockily, and then continues down the hallway.

The hallway was still lighter when the group found another door. Above it, there was another insignia. It was in a bright orange color, and was the insignia for...
124211.title: You really did it Little Vee.

124212.content:
Without thinking, you approach. Your fingers float up to his sleeping soles and contact. They give to your fingers like tiny pillows. A slight press and his toes curl down. Your fingers inch their ways down his buttery soles, caressing each fold. He does not react, however, and the room goes silent. The Biyomon looks confused, but the Hawkmon looks interested. Carefully, he reaches down to Veemon's side and begins poking around. Veemon does not even flinch. Biyomon reaches down as well; soon, several of them are on him. They poke, caress, twiddle, and brush every inch of skin.

Your tongue slides out of your mouth and laps up his soles. A screaming laugh shoots through the room; the Veemon has sprung to life! For good measure, you give the wrinkly soles a few more loving licks. Joyous shouts and helping hands lift him out of the chair and onto his slippery feet. He slips but lands gently on his rear. A quick laugh cuts the momentary tension.

"Thanks everyone. I couldn't have done it without you." Between his smiles to the birds is a slick glance to you. Once again, they help him to his feet. A key hangs from a small slot on the column which the little hero grabs and slings around his neck.

He marches the group to the hall once again. But the challenges have only begun.
124212.title: Victory!

1242122.content:
The hall immediately opens to a large room with a retro pillow-circle cut into the floor. Several doors encompass the room.

"You know," proclaims Biyomon, "Veemon barely made it out of there." An awkward silence follows.

"I know we don't have much time, but maybe we should, well, um..."

"Train?" interjects Veemon.

"Something like that. I heard if you're tickled for a while it really stops tickling so much. This just seems like the place for it, ya know?"

"Well, I don't have much need for training myself, but I'll be happy to help!" The Veemon is clearly happy now.

"You ain't touchin me!" The Meowth crouches defensively.

Most of the group sits on the fence.
1242122.title: Trained for tickling

choices: Start to rally everyone into throwing the Meowth into the room.
Reason with them, don't let them throw him in!  He may help them later!
12421221.content:
"Well, it would be a good idea." floated a quiet voice from the back of the crowd. Everyone quickly turns around to see who had made the statement.

It was a bashful looking Patamon. It was obviously a younger girl, because the voice was to high pitched even for a little boy.

"I'm with her." You agree. In light of your interjection, everyone starts to agree. The patamon looks around bashfully, and blushes when she see's you smiling at her.

"I'll go first." Biyomon said. She blushed as she said this, and everyone fell silent.

"Okay." you say, splitting the silence, "Then sit on that chair, and we'll tickle you." Biyomon nodded in understanding and walked to the couch. Youset down Gatomon, who reluctantly allows this. Biyomon sat down on the couch and waited. You, along with the Veemon, and Hawkmon walked to her. Gatomon clung to the Raichu.

"You sure you want to do this?" Hawkmon asked the volunteer.

"No, but I've gotta do it sometime." She repied smiling at him, "Go ahead, let's get it over with." With that, you take your place at her feet, and Hawkmon sits on her lap. Veemon stands behind the couch, holding her arms above her head.

"Three... Two... One... GO!" You say as you begin tickling. Her feet are very soft, not scaley at all. Her pink nails and soft soles were a dead giveaway that she kept very good care of her feet. Her ribs and stomach were under a fercious attack from Hawkmon, and she already was reduced to tears.

"NYAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA! STOP STOP STOP STAAAAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAAHAP!" Biyomon pleaded. Her pleas fell deaf as you continued to tickle her feet with your nimble claws. You eventually get up enough nerve to give her feet a quick lick. She scrunches her toes and shrieks in protest, but you give her another one anyway. She screeches again and Hawkmon begins to double his tickle techniques. He would scamper his left hand up her ribs and slowly knead her sides with his right.

Her feet eventually go limp and relax. She was exhausted, and couldn't beg anymore. She had given in to the tickling. You cease your tickling immediatly, and allow her to catch her breath. She was very tired after this.

"This won't continue." The voice cracked over the speaker, "You will cease, and you will proceed." You glance at the still panting Biyomon, and the worried Hawkmon. Veemon had long since allowed her arms to fall to her sides.

"Th-th-thanks." She panted, giving a weak smile.

"Don't mention it." You say helping her to her feet. The party begins to move to another hallway, just as dark as the last.

After walking for awhile, you see another door. This one's different. It showed one sign, and it was a sign no one seemed to recognize.

"This room is for anyone to use." The voice crackled over a speaker above them, "When you think about it, there is always that one member of your group that you would love to get rid of." Everyones eyes turned to the Meowth who stood nervously, looking at the door, "You may force one person into this room, and they will undergo tickling on a daily basis for three years. They will be released aftr that, but they won't be the same. You could get rid of that smart-mouthed one person who seems to always bring the group down, but could you live with yourselves knowing that you damned someone to tickling for three years? I leave this to you." The voice crackled away, and silence overtook the room.
12421221.title: Good Idea

choices: Take the Biyomon and Hawkmon door
12421222.content:
"Maybe we should if it looks like the next challenge is going to hinge on self control." This time, the knowledge comes from yourself.

"Makes sense to me," chimes the Hawkmon.

"Well, alright." The Biyomon shrugs it off.

Several more doors stand before you. Where to start?
12421222.title: Keeping up to speed

124212221.content:
A pair of lounge-y chairs sit here. Once again, tall stocks at the feet. This time, however, there are restraints at the end of the arms which rise to shoulder height. One arm on each chair has a small handle with a single button.


"Sit down and strap in." The voice drums on without a TV. They embrace briefly yet sweetly and a whisper is exchanged. You clamp the Biyomon's stocks shut for her while admiring her surprisingly soft feet. Not scaley at all like a regular bird's, the soles flex loosely. The wrist restraints are automatic.

"I know you both love tickling and eachother, but swore to never tickle eachother. You both fear it. But you have nothing to fear. As long as you love eachother as much as it appears you do, you will survive." Optimistic smiles flash around the room due to the unusually cheery message.

"You will be tickled for an hour." The smiles begin to turn grim.

"Hawkmon, the tickling will begin with you. It will continue ceaselessly. After five minutes, your ribs will hurt. About a half hour in, you will begin to hemmorage internally. After an hour, you will likely suffocate." Hawkmon looks utterly panicked.

"But your torture will likely not last that long. Whevenever she wants, Biyomon can give you a break.
All she has to do it hit that little button. As soon as she does, the tickling will be all her's until you take it back with your own button. Simple as that."

"What kind of bullshit is that? An hour tickle and a guarenteed way out. Where's the challenge there?" The meowth simply won't shut up.

The birds stare thoughtfully at eachother as if to gauge eachother's likelyness to take it back. "You can all keep moving. This might take a while" announces Hawkmon dryly.
124212221.title: Cute couple

1242122212.content:
The party mumbles a few words of good luck and trickles out. You, however, decide to stay. Perhaps out of curiosity, or maybe you just want to see them tickled. The Gatomon stays cradled in your arms.

"Why arn't you leaving?" asks Hawkmon. You simply shrug.

"I admit I'm a little excited," coos Biyomon. "I havn't really seen him tickled before." Hawkmon is taken aback.

"You act like you're expecting me to take the blunt of it. You ARE planning on helping me out some, right?" Hawkmon is beginning to sweat.

"Eventually." She sings it, mockingly. Hawkmon tenses up; it is visable in his tense feet. Strong and smooth, they are obviously quite harder than Biyomon's.

A door slides open in the corner and a happy blue creature darts out. It is about your hight and looks like a B-movie creature made into a digimon. Happy, golden eyes lock on the hawkmon's feet and the creature takes off. Two more creatures emerge and the door slams shut.

Hawkmon's muscles tense up and his face contorts awfully. The first creature crouches down at his feet and puts his face only inches away. He smiles a toothy grin and drops his pointy fingers onto Hawkmon's soles. They rake downwards and crawl across his poor soles. Without warning, the other two reach beneath the armrests and grope at his feathery ribs.

Hawkmon screams bloody murder. He kicks and thrashes about as much as he can, but it makes no differece. The devious blue devils laugh at his effort and let their fingers crawl all over his skittish body. As the minutes pass, they keep coming back to his ribs and heels. He cries now; not like a human, but like a hawk. A screaming caw echos only slightly within the room, but it is deafening. They learn that an occasional tickle to his neck makes him fight all the harder. He cries for help to Biyomon in between gasps and screams.

Gatomon runs out, nearly in tears.
1242122212.title: Hawkmon gets his

choices: Take his place for a while
12421222121.content:
"Oh God." Biyomon wears a scared smile and hits the button. A loud buzzer sounds and the creatures pounce on her. Within an instant, the lovely little bird kicks and chirps wildly. Like Hawkmon, her ribs seem to be a particular hotspot. One tortures each little foot with nimble movements. Her feet flutter from the gentle attack, which excites them all the more. Five minutes in, one abandons the feet to help with the ribs. Although it has to hurt, watching her fight is painfully cute.

Out of the blue, one of the creatures does something most unexpected. He turns to you, smiles, and grabs you by the hand. Much stronger than you anticipated, he brings you to your knees only inches from the feet. Then, he steps back and waves towards them. This could only mean one thing.
12421222121.title: Timesharing

124212221211.content:
How could you pass this up! Your hands hover other the sides of her feet. They shake only lightly from the other tickling, which apparently has subsided a bit. The other two creatures have slowed so that they can watch the reaction.

At this distance, you can see her lovely feet much better. Each is thick at the ankle and tapers off quickly towards plump toes. Although the balls and heels are not very pronounced, the arches are quite deep. Each pink nail has a rounded point and a wonderful shine. In short, they are stunning.

Your fingers find their way to the sides and brush their way down. She whimpers sweetly and her soles curl inwards. A single finger finds its way between them and drags its way down. Her already panting breath quickens and she braces for the worst kind of torture. Gentle fingers skittle down the smooth soles and she begins to chirp again. The cuteness is killing you. Your fingers dart all over the soles and, when they curl up too much, over the tops of her feet as well. They are weak, however, and vainly attempt to brush your hands away.

*BZZT*

Right before he is sent into laughter, you could swear you saw a smile of absolute love on Hawkmon's face.
124212221211.title: Helping Hands

1242122212112.content:
Smiling warmly on the lovebirds, you spin on your heel and begin walking out.

"Ga..huh...huh..b.." Biyomon pants your name out with the little strength she has.

"Its..been..fun..huh.." She smiles playfully at you. You return the smile, surprised, and leave.

Out in the hall, an Agumon has just completed what looks to have been a grueling challenge. He is nearly passed out in the circle wring with the key around his neck.

The group stands scattered, yet ready to recollect. One door catches your attention.
1242122212112.title: Giving them some quality time

12421222121121.content:
"I'm not scared! This will be a cakewalk!" Meowth's unflinching bravado is put aside only long enough for him to open the door.

Inside is a tall stool, another pair of footstocks, and a small overhead box.

"Sit down and strap in." The voice has become commonplace now, but has not lost its edge.

The meowth slams his feet into the stocks, throws down the top, and sticks his hands into the box.

"Meowth," drones the voice, "You are a horrible creature. The Meowth you see before you has a nasty little habit. He likes to kidnap monsters and tickle them for days in his basement. Usually, he ends up killing them and hiding the bodies. All in all, over twenty have parished this way."

"You're sick! SICK!" The Gatomon is livid now. She clenches her fists and stomps with tears in her eyes. You couldn't agree more. Already, you find yourself considering tickling the shit out of him.

"What do you think this is!?" Meowth shouts as if he has gained an edge.

"Punishment and, in some cases, redemption. You do it for pleasure."

"Whatever you say, chief!" A glint of victory shines in Meowth's eye.

"You will likely have the worst torture today. It seems that you have angered your former peers. That is bad news for you, because they will be your torturers."

"WHAT!?" Meowth's temporary victory has quickly died.

"They see this from my point of view, I say. There are over 23 hours remaining in this house, and I fear you will be tickled for the majority of them. Unless, that is, you push that small button in the box overhead." His hands twiddle with the button. "Just press that button and you will be released. No more torture. That is, except for the sad side effects of being locked in this place for the rest of your life. Humiliation and torture by those you have been ridiculing from the beginning."

"Based on the gravity of your crimes, I have included another possibility. Because there are other possibilities outside these personal rooms to earn keys, I have included a small knife in this room."

A raichu spots it first: a Kabar fighting knife is mounted near the door. Hardly small.

"If you wish to escape, you will have to endure your companions' torture and draw enough pity from them to avoid your murder. Should you do that, the key is yours."

The voice clicks off; only a panicked Meowth remains.
12421222121121.title: At last

12421222121122.content:
Something about a door in this place being blank draws your imagination. A challenge for anyone, or perhaps a group challenge? Maybe if you're in luck, its an easy ticket out of here.

The entire group crams into the room; its one of the brightest rooms here by far. When your eyes adjust, the horror of the situation presents itself.

Before you sits a chair with a low pair of footstocks. This pair, however, has a large guillotine built into it. An uncharacteristically clean blade perches utop it. Gatomon covers her mouth in horror and tries to leave, only to find that the door has locked. Terror sets in.

"Before you all overreact, I suggest you hear the terms of this room." You can barely make out the monotone over Gatomon's sobbing.

"As many or as few of you may use this room as you wish. Contrary to what it may look like, it is utterly painless. It is also the coward's way out."

The group begins to curiously examine the menacing structure. A renamon nearly reaches for the blade to test it, but recoils at the last minute due to her better sense.

"Anyone that wants a key out of here need only sit down, strap in, and throw the little switch on the structure. Your feet will fall off quickly, painlessly, and bloodlessly. You can still feel them; you can still move them. But if you want the key out, you will place them in that chute to your right." A plain laundry chute stands nearly flush with the wall.

"A loner pair will arrive moments later. They will move, they will feel, but they will not be ticklish. Along with them will be a key, just for you. After you leave this place, I will keep your feet for a year. During that time, days may go by where you are not tickled at all. Others may go by in which you are tickled all day. After that year, you will likely hate me more than anyone else here, and rightfully so. But mostly, you will hate yourself. I will eventually mail your feet back to you, and you may even keep the other pair as souvenirs. The choice belongs to each of you."

An odd silence fills the room.
12421222121122.title: The Coward's way out

choices: Turn around and get to a other one.
124212221211221.content:
You listened careful to all words he spoke, followed the point of the screen toward the laundry chute and then looks at the being again, now looking around at the scared faces of all others, frozen. If they are frozen of leave without harm that easily or because of this cruel looking device you don't know. But only one thing you know exactly.

You walked toward the device and the being in the Screen smiles, laughs. "Oh....that fast? I thought it will take longer until someone want to leave this house this cowardly, weakly and spineless...." "I'm not doing it...." This words seems to shock the being a bit and it stopped laughing. Your voice rose and you grabbed the wooden holding of the guillotine. Your strong Arms and sharp teeth digs in the wood and the thin, only for holding and lead the blade constructed wood, crackles and breaks and with a loud screams of the other wooden bar, falls now the guillotine down and slams on the ground, shatters. You stand during this on the stock and stare in the now more feared faces of the group. "PEOPLE!" you shout loudly. "Nobody of us wants to be here and we are not spineless like this crazy guy thinks! We have our powers, our hands and will never break away away...."

Slowly started the group to smile and the Gatomon, you had hold in your arms before starts to yell, but powers yous leading, powerful speech, looking like a revolutionist, foot on the broken device and the light shines from over you, gave you a look like a hero and this feeling, to be not helpless, not be in the hands of a crazy guy, waved over and more and more of the group shouted at your speech, yelling to never give up and never will give in this torturous offer which isn't worth to take.

The being was speechless and listen, was totally confused but in a way feeling proud that they not give up, not kneel to his rules because that made his teaching even more interesting. Now he had to break a will, the fighting will so the effect of his teaching will be greater as he had planned before. You, the Gabumon, turns around and stares now in the face of the mysterious being, in the cam which he used to watch. "WE all will stay together! No one of us will ever pass and will be cowardly. You maybe teach us how ticklish we are, but we will show you, you have a fuck of a idea how bigger our courage is, how hard it will be to break down the will of fighting!"

With this words, the being spoke evilly and laughing. "Very well. A big speech but it will be useless. Then go on and take the challenges which waits at you all. We will see, how long your will will stay that good...." With this words, the screen got out and the the door opens again and you goes out, proudly. "Come on people! Let us kick him in his crazy, naughty ass!" All shouted loudly "YES! LET US DO IT!" before they followed you along the corridor into a big hall, looking like a gym but around the gym are many restrains, chairs, stocks and pillories in many weird combinations. The voice joins again. "Welcome in the running gym. Rules are easy: You all know the game of musical chairs. This is a slight different version of it. Around here are many restrains to take place in. But first, I need three people which join free....."

What you do now?
124212221211221.title: Break through the wood

1242122212112211.content:
A Renamon, a Gatomon and a Rukario walked now forward as now three tubes appear, ankle cuffs there, like some for the the wrists. "You three get place in the tubes." They did and got in, cuffed as now the tubes lifts up and locks up, the Renamon suddenly noticed pipes toward the tube and shivers. Rikario looks around but suddenly found a gas-mask on his muzzle then unable to get it off. And Gatomon, well, the restrains pulled her around and spread her horizontal in it. She looks afraid but then saw in the eyes of you, the Gabumon, felt the honor and relax. "All others of you, have now the task to run a restrain and get in quick as possible when the music starts playing. But there will be everytime one restrain will be lesser as persons. When the music stops, you all get tickled for five minutes. But the hook: One restrain will not stop tickling after the five minutes but I will not say, which it is. You don't need to haste when the music stops but if i notice anyone in no restrain after the music stops, the three in the tubes get tickled by my special inventions, the tickle slim, my tickle gas and my feather bed."

All looks shivering around but seems to trust you with your words you did before. "Ready for the fun?"
1242122212112211.title: Challenge for everyone

124212221211222.content:
At least this way you won't die, right? But you don't want to be tickled for a year, either. Hell, what is this guy's problem. It's really not worth it, is it? Everyone else is still trying to decide, too.

Except for one. Gatomon, sobbing lightly, clamps the footstocks down and takes a deep breath.

"Wait! Are you s..."

And that's all you get out. Gatomon's furry little feet fall to the floor with muffled thumps. She pulls her ankles from the stocks, picks up her feet, and heads for the chute. She cries all the way.
124212221211222.title: A coward in the room

choices: Head on to the next room
1242122212112222.content:
You nearly tackle her. She drops one paw without a fight, which you snatch up and lob into the crowd. The other she keeps a grip on, and you don't want to hurt it in the struggle. A quick tickle on the sole makes her lose her grip. You get back to the crowd, and whoever got the other paw has been keeping her nearly immobile with laughter.

You plop into the corner and the group parts to let you see Gatomon. Her paw is about five inches long, four wide, and sports a pale little dot in the center. Her plump toes thrash about to try to make you lose your grip. You tighten just enough to combat her wiggling toes and drag your tiny claws along her pad. They rake through the plush fur, and the thrashing finally dies down and the soles tense up. You look at her to see a cowering ball of fur.

"Is this what you want for another year? Every day, maybe all day?" Your hands slow and suddenly pounce between her cowering toes. She laughs wildly and shakes her head. Then, something amazing happens.

"This room is not for you." The voice crackles to life. "You should listen to this one and see your own room."

"What about the rest of us?" a Treeko interjects. With that, the voice goes silent again.

You pick up Gatomon under the arms and she looks at you with tearstained eyes. "Thank you," she whispers. You hold her paw back to her ankle, and it jumps back on like a magnet. Her other paw is on before you even see who had it. You cradle her close and leave the room behind.
1242122212112222.title: Saving Gatomon

12421222121122222.content:
"I'm ready for my room," Gatomon whispers.

"Are you sure you don't need to rest?"

"Positive." And you believe her. "But will you do me a favor?"

"Name it."

"Stay with me until it's done." You nod in agreement.

Gatomon's room is connected directly to the lounge-y room. Not too hard to find; you carry her in.

Surprise! A tiny seat with a tiny pair of footstocks and a pair of clamps attached to the head. "You know the drill," says the voice with a hint of a laugh. So, you set her on the stool, clamp her dainty little feet in, and cuff her wrists to the head. Her expression turns grim as she tugs at the restraints.

"Gatomon, you have nothing to worry about. Your room has no way to kill you, and you will get a key by the time you are done here." She immediately perks up.

"Really?" she smiles to the intercom.

"Really. I am here to help you, after all. You have turned a cold shoulder to anyone who has tried to tickle you. Your friends, your family, and beyond. Didn't you even leave a pet on the street because he woke you up with a tickle one time?" She hangs her head in silence.

"I'm going to tickle you for a while. It might take a long while, but I'll go easy. It will stop as soon as I am convinced that you love being tickled. There is no way to opt out at this point, but you won't need one. Plus, I want to see you tickled more. It's cute."

The last comment caught you off guard, but was oddly calming.

A little metal claw comes out from under the seat on a robotic tentacle. Gatomon eyes it until it crawls into her pit. Her curious eyes become pinpricks and her laugh is caught in her throat. It releases in a fit of giggles and she squirms around on her seat. The laughing lets up as the claw switches sides and starts digging into her other armpit. After a bit, the claw retracts and a single curious feather emerges. It lifts up to her face, wiggles playfully, and brushes along the inside of her ear. She meows agitatedly as it drags down the side of her face. The minutes tick by.

A mechanical hum startles you. Behind you, what resembles a metal easy chair slides out of the wall.

"If you're planning on staying this whole time, you might as well relax. You still have your own torment to look forward too, you know." You chuckle dryly and are mildly alarmed to find your captor to be laughing the same way. So, you sit. And the minutes keep ticking.

Your mouth is parched now although you've only been in this room for a little under an hour. Wow, that long already? Your arm jerks back instinctually as a tiny hatch on the chair's arm opens. Much to your surprise and delight, a tall glass of orange juice emerges. You raise your glass with a chuckle to the camera in the corner.

By this time, tiny feathers spin on Gatomon's heels. Her feet kick around wildly. "Ooooo... THISISSOMUCHFUN!!" You have a hard time believing her, naturally. Instead of sarcasm, you suspect a downright lie. Her kicking feet are hypnotic, and her laugh is contageous.
12421222121122222.title: Gato's room

124212221211222222.content: You really want to tickle Gatomon's feet. Suddenly, the chair moves towards her feet. "If you want to tickle her, go ahead. I'll let you take over for a bit." The voiceover says as the feather attached to the tentacle changes back to a mechanical hand and gestures to her wriggling feet. Do you?
124212221211222222.title: A Chance for a tickle!

1242122212112222221.content:
What an opportunity! Gatomon pants deeply, the tickling tentacle having momentarily ceased.

"Do you mind?" You ask for the sake of politeness.

"Go easy, my ribs are starting to hurt." Immediately after saying this, she yips in pain.

"Just a little painkiller," buzzes the voice "to keep you going."

"Where does it hurt? Right here?" You perch your fleshy hand on her plump belly and wiggle your fingers about ever so slowly. She laughs and coos and recoils slightly. Your fingers knead into her little hips and Gatomon bucks from side to side, tears streaming down her face. "Having fun yet?"

info.brief_description: The Horror of tickling. Expect cartoon cameos and perhaps a bit of gore.
info.description:
You know the movie SAW? Well, jigsaw wanted to make people appreciate life because he could not, right?

Here we have you, the god-knows-what, trapped at the mercy of TNail. This creature cannot be tickled and wants to teach you and several others how to appreciate their ticklishness. The exact nature of the horrors is up to you, the writers. Expect cartoon cameos again, but perhaps a little gore as well.

Also, I want to try something even stranger yet. Because of the nature of this story, I encourage changing the point of view often.
